text:
I noticed John Mayer for the first time in 2003 when his show "Any Given Thursday" was playing in a DirecTV channel. I felt in love with his songs right away. 
I couldn't get out of my house at the time because I had agoraphobia. So I watched a lot of TV. And John's amazing voice comforted me at the time. 
I couldn't leave my house, because I thought I would feel nauseated, dizziness and other symptoms. So I panicked everytime I had to go out. Specially in crowded places. 
I lost contact with friends, I lost contact with the boy I liked. My life was hell... I was miserable. Thought I would never go out of that situation.
So, 14 years later John came to Brazil to perform on Allianz Parque, a famous stadium. It was almost full house, and I was there. I mean, I did it! I went to his concert. Something I would never imagined doing: seeing the guy that was one of the things that helped me spend my time while "locked" in my house. If I went back in 2003 and said to the 18 years old me that I would see that guy perform in a crowded stadium, I think I wouldn't have believed it.
This is one the songs that remind me of that time.
Although I was almost cured from agoraphobia a couple years later, I still have to deal with my mental health till today. But everytime I listen to a song from that time, and in this case, John Mayer's, I see that my life back then was not all dark, there was a light waiting for me, although I couldn't see anything in front of me, only despair.
So..
Thank you, John. Just thank you. 💓
